Line: Episode 312
By Daniel Stashower & Sonny Wareham Gate spinning, splashes into life, iris shuts. Jack and Sam walk into the Control room.
Whats up?
Receiving GDO transmission, sir. Its the Tokra.
Open the iris. Maybe its Dad.
Maybe.
Martouf. How are you?
Samantha. Colonel ONeill. Well enough, under the circumstances.
whats wrong?
Maybe we should discuss this elsewhere.
Its my father.
Im afraid hes been captured by Sokar.
Oh my God.
As far as we know he is still alive.
As far as you know?
You are familiar of how Sokar has assumed the persona of the entity known on Earth as the Devil.
Yeah. Bit pretentious, dont ya think?
You must understand when I say that if Selmak is still alive, he has been sent to hell.
As in...
A place of eternal suffering and damnation from which there is no return.
So, what are we really talking about here?
Netu is a moon orbiting Sokars home planet.
A very hot moon, I take it?
It is indeed a place where fire burns strong.
But you know for sure that my father is still alive?
I am sorry, Samantha. I know this must be difficult. Once captured, Selmak and Jacob your father would have been brutally tortured But Sokar would rather see his victims suffer than die.
So were talking about a rescue mission.
Unfortunately, to our knowledge, no one has ever escaped from Netu.
Oh.
No one except for Jolinar.
Oh.

Of course it makes sense. The Goauld impersonating the Devil would naturally create a place like Netu. Netu is from the book of Am-Taut which is kind of how-to guide to passage through the ancient Egyptian otherworld regions. And many of those regions are described as dark places with pits of fire home to hellish monsters and damned.
What little we know is largely based on the legends that have been perpetuated by Sokar himself.
How did Jolinar get out?
She never said.
And no one ever asked her how she escaped from an inescapable prison?

She was found unconscious and badly injured in a Teltak, a cargo ship, floating in space. Her recovery was long and painful. She was encouraged to remember how she escaped but she refused to speak of it.
Anyone curious as to why?
I implored her but she would not say.
I only carried Jolinar for a short time. Ive never had anything more than scattered flashes of her memories, occasionally some dreams, but never anything like this place youre describing.
The Tokra have technology that aids in the recall of memories, but you must be willing to use it.
If were going in on this one, sir, were going to need some more units.
A full military incursion will be impossible, Colonel ONeill.
We do covert.

Selmaks recovery is obviously a high priority, however, and forgive me, Samantha, there is something larger at stake. The Tokra believe that Sokar is planning to launch a massive attack against the System Lords.
Isnt that good news?
The chaotic and feudal disorganisation of the System Lords fragmented rule is a far more vulnerable target than that of one powerful Goauld.
Especially if that Goauld is Sokar.
Hes really that much worse than the others?
Well, of all the gods he picked to impersonate he chose the Devil.
We need to find Selmak and determine what information he has gathered about Sokars attack. Without wanting to sound overly-dramatic, the fate of the Galaxy might be at stake
Sounds a bit overly dramatic
Sounds like we cant refuse. Colonel you have a go
When do we leave?
As soon as you are ready. If you are sure you are all sure you understand what you are volunteering for.
You said hell, right?
Well, Im gonna end up there sooner or later. May as well check out the neighbourhood.
The Teltak we will require for our journey awaits us on the planet Vorash
Ship?
There is no Stargate on Netu. Those banished there are taken by ship
Have I mentioned to you that I hate surprises?
We have a long journey ahead of us. There will be much time to inform you of all the details.
Ah! Now that puts me in a position to be surprised.
Chevron seven is locked
Major, you will bring your father back safely
Yes, sir. We will.
get ready
Tealc!
This ship looks familiar

This is the same Teltak that Jolinar was found adrift. It was severely damaged when we found it. Essential flight mechanisms have been repaired, however, the hyperdrive engines can only be run at 40% without too much risk.
Is this vessel equipped with stealth capabilities?
The ship we were in could make itself invisible
Really?
It was an upgrade. Youre obviously dealing with your base model here.
Are you sure you can fly a ship such as this?
With great proficiency
While we are on the surface, you may have to avoid Sokars forces
Isnt Tealc coming with us?

He cannot. The atmosphere around the moon is impenetrable by ship. The only way to reach the surface is in the descent pods. It is how all the damned are sent to sent to Netu by Sokar, and it how we must also arrive if we are to convince the Denizens we can be trusted
And there are only four pods
This counts as a surprise you know.
Shall we embark?
By all means. To hell with us.
Tealc, were almost ready. Tealc, do you copy?
So what else can you tell us about Netu?
The moon was once an industrialised colony of the planet Delmak. When Sokar conquered Delmak he made it his homeworld. He transformed the moons environment to suit the myths.
sounds like he went to an awful lot of trouble
he filled the atmosphere with barely breathable toxins, then blasted numerous holes in the surface, releasing the molten core. As I apply the memory device, you will feel a slight pain
weve actually already experienced this technology before
good. Then you will know what to expect
so were actually going to see Jolinars memories appear as... holographic images?
there are no specific way of targeting certain memories. Some of Samanthas personal memories may surface. Out of respect for her privacy we will not be using this part of the technology.
thank you
you can describe what you see
kneel before Na'onak!
you shall call me Na'onak no longer From this day forth I shall reclaim my rightful name...
Sam?
In here
why are you crying?
wheres Mom?
oh God...
listen to me, Samantha.
Im sorry, Im stuck in my own past
think of Jolinar. The last night we spent together before she was captured by Sokar. We walked along the ridge of Noctana. There were two moons out that night.
I see it
move away!
you didnt speak of Jolinar leaving. You both knew it was dangerous but she had to go
you stayed up all night together
Martouf.
are you OK?
I want to try it again
I should have said this earlier. I know my relationship with Jolinar is a source of discomfort for you.
Martouf...

I would just like you to know that it has always been my belief that Jolinar kept her experiences from Netu a secret as she feared it would come between us. I do not want you to hold anything back for the same reason. You dont have to protect me.
shut it off! Shut it off!
do it!
I am sorry. The memory technology can provide very realistic sensory recall
she was tortured... so badly
I am going to turn it on again, but at a lower setting
she was on a ship like this one. They put her in a descent pod. There was... fire all around. It was hard to breath.
its gone. I lost it
we will arrive soon
I know, Martouf. Im sorry. Maybe Im not going to be able to do this
you have to
hey, Marty. A word?
youre pushing a little hard dont ya think?
there is not much time left
its her father. She knows the stakes
if she does not remember Jolinars method of escape I will not allow any of you to accompany me down to the surface
why?
because anyone who goes down there will likely not return.
but youre gonna go
I will attempt to locate Selmak and communicate any relevant information to you. You will then return to Vorash and relay it the Tokra
and leave and Jacob down there to, what? Rot?
with no means of escape...
alright, first of all, Carters not going to let you go without her. Secondly, I wont let it happen, and thirdly, Jolinar escaped
but if Samantha cannot recall how...
I know, I heard you. And forgive the bravado, but its been done before. It can be done again
you going to be OK?

yeah. Its just so confusing. Images and faces. Fragments of thoughts and feelings... There was a Goauld on Netu. Not Sokar. He was... lets just say he was less than attractive. I know his name I just cant find it. And I get this horrible sick feeling when I remember him
something happened between him and Jolinar
something worse than the torture and pain. Something Jolinar never wanted Martouf to find out about
we have arrived at the co-ordinates
we must keep the device hidden from any Denizens we encounter. I will keep it on a low setting so you may continue to work through Jolinars memories as we go. Is that OK?
yeah, of course
Carter
Sokar would not send someone down to Netu with weapons
yeah, so?
if they are discovered on you the Denizens will know we were not sent by Sokar. We must attempt to blend in the hope that we will be able to move about freely as Denizens
we believe that this device will be able to penetrate the atmosphere
"we believe"?
we should be able to speak to Tealc as long as the ship remains in orbit of the moon
thats err... thats still a long way down
the pods are launched at a great velocity
and thats supposed to make me feel better, or...?
they are equipped with heat dampening shields and anti-gravity wave generators that will slow our descent
so, smooth sailing all the way, right?
not exactly, ONeill
are you prepared?
ah, no. Not really.
ONeill, can you hear me?
I read you, Tealc
you are now entering the atmosphere... Colonel ONeill?
ONeill, can you hear me?
Carter? Daniel?
over here!
this way
lets move
well, at least its a dry heat
Colonel ONeill, respond
yeah, Tealc, were in one piece. Just hang tight, well be in touch
we should follow this tunnel
you remember?
being here has helped. This should led us to the old remains of the underground colony. Its one of the only inhabitable places left
is it me, or is actually getting hotter?
little of both I think
theres something up ahead
this way
well, its certainly not Emerald City.
Howdy folks. Were new in these parts. I know its hard to tell but its true. Carter?
Bynarr.
what does that mean?
its the name I couldnt remember. weve come to see Bynarr
who are you?
people of little consequence, pay no attention to us
kneel before me
whos this guy?
he is Na'onak, first prime to Bynarr, Lord of Netu.
weve come to see Bynarr
you will not. Banish them to the surface
I dont think so. Back off a little there, folks
who asks for me by name?
I do! Im Samantha Carter, host of Jolinar of Malkshur
take their weapons. Throw them in the pit.
Boys. Pit
thank you! The smells keep getting better and better
so, this doesnt look very encouraging
I thought Sokar wouldnt allow weapons. So far weve seen a staff weapon and a hand device
I don not understand it myself
surprise, surprise
Bynarr is Sokars appointed leader. He is allowed one hand device and one staff weapon for his First prime.
why did you think Binar would be sympathetic to Jolinar?
I was sure he was the one who helped her escape
why?
she... errr...
Im sorry. Look, hes the key. Bynarr may not have knowingly helped Jolinar, but Im sure he must know how she escaped
Sam? Sam?
Dad? Dad! Dad...
am I dreaming?
no were real
are you crazy?
apparently
are you OK?
been better
Selmak?
hes dying
this will help.
hang in there. Were gonna get you out
Marty...
thank you
he gonna make it?
not here. Unless we get him out of here soon, he will die
its OK
I am humbled by your presence, my lord Sokar
Bynarr, Lord of Netu, I do not have time to hear of the sufferings of the Damned on this day
allow me to offer thanks for returning the Tokra Jolinar, the one who betrayed me, so that I may seek my revenge
of what do you speak?
she arrived today with three others
I did not send her to you. They are intruders. Find out what they want, then kill them
I had hoped to take my revenge on Jolinar solely, my Lord. To see her suffer in the harshest ways of the Damned
go now! Report back to me in one day. Heed my command
without fail my Lord
a ship brought these intruders. Find it, and destroy it
yes, my Lord
do you have the strength to speak?
we can relay communication to the Tokra Council
Sokars felt is 10 times larger than we thought. He is poised to attack six system lords. He will win
he will control an army big enough to rule the galaxy if that is so
when is all this supposed to happen?
the attack was due to take place two weeks from the time I was captured. That was 4 days ago
we must relay this to the Tokra immediately
Tealc, come in
ONeill, it is I
we found Jacob, hes in pretty rough shape
have you as yet determined a means of escape
err... no. not yet. Martouf wants to talk to you
Tealc, I have an important message you must relay to the High Council if we do not get out of here
Samantha Carter. You will come with me
whos calling?
now
come and get her yourself you...
Sir, this may be our only way out here
how do you figure?
if I could just get close to Binar, talk to him
move!
yeah, OK. Go ahead
look after my Dad
Tealcs not responding
he said hed be there, right?
if he is not...
hell be there
enter
take it
you have no symbiote within you
no
how then do you know of Jolinar?
I once carried her
I should have known. Jolinar would rather have died on the surface before she faced me
because she betrayed you?
look what Sokar took from me because of her. Where is she now?
shes dead
you know how she escaped?
I dont. I dont remember
why did you come here?
Sam?
shell be back
where is she?
shes with Bynarr
Samantha believes Bynarr is the key to our escape
Bynarr is Sokars eyes and ears
well, eye anyway
he ensures there are no uprisings
keeps the conditions liveable
and he reports to Sokar regularly. Sokar enjoys hearing about the suffering
whats that?
Sokar comes here?
no. Bynarr goes to the planet
how do you know?
I saw him there before I was captured
do you know how he gets there?
we gotta go
almost
our most recent addition is the Tokra Selmak. Have you come to rescue him? Did you think I helped Jolinar escape?
yes
why?
because you loved her
you are mistaken
then why do hate her so much?
her death has robbed me of the revenge I have long dreamed of
I wont get the same satisfaction from killing you, but I will get some
no, wait!
you alright?
Dad?
hanging in there
there are transportation rings in Bynarrs quarters
they must lead to Sokars place
once there Jolinar managed to steal a cargo ship and escape
whats goin on up there?
Na'onak just killed Bynarr
what?
why?
I have no idea. Bynarr was about to kill me, Na'onak came in and shot him with a staff weapon. He didnt say a word, he just sent me back down here
the Denizens will riot
this could be our shot
to do what? The rings lead to Sokars palace
hey! Its a way out of here
Jolinar was one person and she had a hand device
leave me
err, Jacob, you seem to be missing the whole point
Tealc
is that possible?
what?
the cargo ship has rings
the cargo ship work like Stargates only over shorter distances. They transport a matter stream. If that matter stream is intercepted...
whoa! Simplify, please
if Tealc can manoeuvre the cargo ship into the correct position theoretically we should be able to transport aboard
theoretically?
how does he find the right position?
the ring mechanism has sensors that can locate other rings. Tealc should be able to detect the co-ordinates
Ill take those odds. Cmere!
Tealc, its Daniel, come in.
Tealc, do you copy?
I do, Daniel Jackson
Tealc, come in, over
what are you doing?
Im just communicating with my friend with this little device
Tealc, we need you, do you copy?
I copy
this way
Martouf says the ring device on the ship should be able to locate the path the matter stream will take
I will be in position
its gone. The key that activates the rings is gone
where was the key to be inserted?
over here
can you make it work?
it will take time
take all you need
